incidents.name: Super SIM Network Connectivity Issues

incident_updates.body: Network connectivity issue has been resolved and service is operating normally at this time.

We are still seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are now seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue while the affected devices are reconnecting. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues. Beginning at 02:48 UTC, we observed ~5% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on ~5% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: Connectivity on devices with active data sessions on Super SIM incident has been resolved and service is operating normally at this time.

We are observing an improvement in connectivity on devices with active data sessions on Super SIM. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We will continue to monitor to ensure full service recovery. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 10:14 UTC, we observed ~6.8% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Flex Queue Stats Not Refreshing Properly

incident_updates.body: Real-time Queue View stats in Flex is operating normally at this time. The incident has been resolved.

Real-time Queue View stats in Flex is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Real-time Queue View stats in Flex is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Real-time Queue View stats in Flex is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue causing the Flex Queue Stats to not refresh properly, and have deployed a fix. New task queues will now report correct statistics. However, task queues that were already affected may continue to show incorrect statistics. Our engineering team is still actively working to fix the corrupted data. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue causing the Flex Queue Stats to not refresh properly, and have deployed a fix. New task queues will now report correct statistics. However, task queues that were already affected may continue to show incorrect statistics. Our engineering team is actively working to fix the corrupted data. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still investigating an issue with Flex Queue Stats. The Waiting Task counter is not refreshing properly, therefore, customers may experience piling up with tasks that are no longer waiting. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue investigating an issue with Flex Queue Stats. The Waiting Task counter is not refreshing properly, therefore, customers may experience piling up with tasks that are no longer waiting. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Devices Using Super SIM May Experience Issues Receiving OTA Updates

incident_updates.body: The issue causing devices using Super SIM to experience missing OTA updates has been resolved, and it is operating normally at this time.

We are now seeing recovery of the issue causing devices using Super SIM to experience missing OTA updates. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are now seeing recovery of the issue causing devices using Super SIM to experience missing OTA updates. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The issue causing devices using Super SIM to experience missing OTA updates has been identified. The affected service on the partners side has been restarted. We are checking if the missing events could be replayed. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

The issue causing a small set of devices (less than 1%) using Super SIM has been identified. We are working with our partners to investigate the root cause. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified that since 13th of June there could be an issue where a small set of devices using Super SIM wont receive any OTA updates. We are actively working to identify and resolve the issue. Likewise, we will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: 504s Errors in the Twilio Console

incident_updates.body: The Twilio Console was degraded for 2 minutes, between 9:32 AM to 9:34 AM Pacific time. During this period of time, a small set of customers were intermittently unable to complete console interactions and received 504s on the Twilio Console. Authy 2FA was confirmed not to be impacted, but some customers that needed to perform 2FA were unable to do so due to 504s errors. The issue has now been resolved.

The Twilio Console was degraded, and our engineers continue to investigate the exact impact times. During this period of time, customers were intermittently unable to complete console interactions and received 504s on the Twilio Console. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of this retroactive issue with 2FA. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with the Twilio Console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Unable to Login into Flex

incident_updates.body: Intermittent service disruption issues with the Flex Twilio platform have been resolved and service is operating normally at this time.

Were seeing recovery in intermittent service disruption issues with the Flex Twilio platform. Customers may experience connection errors or failures while logging into their Flex account. Flex insights is now confirmed not to be impacted by this incident, so were making a correction regarding customer impact. As a workaround, we suggest clearing out cache data by following these steps:

- Open flex.twilio.com or the customer specific flex domain
- Click the lock icon at the beginning of the site address in the URL bar
- Click on Site Settings
- A new tab will open with settings for the site.
- Click Clear Data

If the steps above dont work, please try to use the browsers incognito mode.

Well continue to monitor for service stability and well provide an update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

- Click Clear Data

If the steps above dont work, please try to use the browsers incognito mode.

Well continue to monitor for service stability and well provide an update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

- Open flex.twilio.com or the customer specific flex domain
- Click the lock icon at the beginning of the site address in the URL bar
- Click on Site Settings
- A new tab will open with settings for the site.
- Click Clear Data

If the steps above dont work, please try to use the browsers incognito mode.

We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Programmable Wireless API Returning Elevated HTTP 500 Error Rates

incident_updates.body: We have identified and redeployed the affected host. The issue has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

We have identified and redeployed the affected host. We are seeing recovery from the API errors and are monitoring closely for any changes. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or sooner once more information becomes available.

We are experiencing elevated HTTP 500 error rates from the Commands API. The elevated error rates may result in loss of failed commands. Client software should retry sending the commands from their end. 

Also, there might be high latency when loading Programmable Wireless pages via Console. Our engineering team is actively investigating the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on ~5 % of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing network connectivity issue. This incident has been resolved.

We are now seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 14:13 UTC, we observed ~5 % of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: TaskRouter affected

incident_updates.body: Twilio TaskRouter was degraded for 40 minutes between 3:50 and 4:30 Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have experienced an increase in timed out TaskRouter Reservations. The issue has now been resolved.

During this period, customers may have experienced an increase in timed out TaskRouter Reservations. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.
